34907632.review:
The Cat and the Coup is a simple Flash game where you play the cat of a Mohammed Mossadegh, the first democratically elected leader of Iran and the head of Nationalist Party of Iran. You will play Iran's history in reverse from the 1960s to the 1950s. You will realise that the heart of all this conflict is for energy, mainly Iran's oil. You will learn of characters such as Kermit Roosevelt, the main CIA agent that engineered the fall of Mossadegh. You will learn that the bribe budget to oust Mossadegh was approximately around $1,000,000 USD. You will learn of the Iran's Shah,  Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, and how he temporarily got his throne back due to Kermit Roosevelt's aid. As for the rest of history, I will let you play the game to learn more about Iran's history.

Gameplay-wise, there is nothing special. You simply move the cat using WASD into special little cat cutouts and press the Spacebar. There is a little balancing beam act but it's childish.

Conclusion, do try the game. It is slightly less informative than Wikipedia and not properly organised by timeline but you will figure the game out. 

[h1][b]PROS[/b][/h1]
1. Free
It's really free. It's sponsored by an educational fund.

2. Partial History Lesson
It's all about Iran's oil and how Britain and the USA will topple governments for that oil.

[h1][b]CONS[/b][/h1]
1. Boring Gameplay
There isn't even a decent puzzle.

2. Not Organised by Timeline
It jumps from place to place. Worse still, there is no chronological order.

33894597.review:
This is a very small (20 minute) puzzle game. The premise is an allegory about British and US foreign policy toward Iran in the 20th century. It's free and short, and it's good.

Mohammad Mosaddegh was Prime Minister of Iran from 1951 until 1953. He was a champion of secular, democratic values, and sought to modernise Iran by nationalising its oil industry. Having been democratically elected by the people of Iran, he was overthrown in a coup organised by the CIA and British intelligence services.

Why was nationalisation of oil so contentious? In the early 1950s, many key industries in Western states were nationalised, or part-owned by the state. The UK had itself just nationalised its coal and steel industries. But as the Cold War developed, the US became more hawkish about any states showing socialist tendencies. As the UK's might withered and its postwar ration economy continued to struggle, the British state attempted desperately to assert its interests in the Middle East.

This revanchiste British foreign policy, upheld by a Conservative administration but instigated by a Labour Prime Minister, would eventually culminate in the disastrous attempt to hold the Suez Canal of 1956. It also meant protecting British supplies of cheap oil. If the Iranian government were to control the nation's oil reserves, then it could set its own prices. When Mossaddegh sought to limit the influence of the Anglo-Iranian Oil Company (AIOC), the AIOC refused to cooperate. Iran responded by nationalising their assets. The UK initiated a worldwide boycott of Iranian oil, and began an extensive programme of bribery and co-ercion to protect its interests in Iran. The situation escalated into a coup signed off by the British and US governments at the highest levels. A democratically-elected government had been overthrown by a foreign power for trying to take a local resource into the people's hands.

The Cat and the Coup briefly tells this story using a few headlines, photographs, mockups, and collage art. The game is a sequence of about six vignette puzzles, each of which takes about two minutes to complete. Mossaddegh's ghost enters a room symbolising a moment in his own memory, and the player, his cat, forces him to leave or encourages him to follow a falling object. It's all rather strange, and not overly polished, but it's intuitive enough, and not difficult enough to be frustrating. The animations are lovely. I think you should play this game.

31154596.review:
从游戏性上来说，这一款11年的免费游戏放在如今很难说它是款好游戏——虽然游戏流程很短（我的时长是因为刚开始玩不久就接了一个超过1小时的电话XD），但玩到一半已经能看明白游戏大部分解谜设置：谜题与场景粗暴的结合以及最最基础的重力要素。
但从整体上来说，我愿意称它为一款不错且值得体验的作品。
游戏最吸引我的就是那天马行空的画面，细看你会觉得每一个美术素材都很粗糙，但场景的拼接和氛围的塑造，和那些颇有意思但在游戏中毫无操作机会的过场场景，完全当得起“天马行空”一词。对比那粗糙的素材你都不知道该说这个人到底是美术功底好还是不好，但又因为这种啼笑皆非的荒诞感，更加觉得这款游戏本身就带有一定的艺术性。
此外，游戏的配乐也算比较不错，很符合游戏的核心思想；政治讽刺很多，但我不太了解，就不提惹。
别对这款“游戏”抱有什么期待，就当做是一次简短的体验吧。

29933982.review:
An enticing visual story of the imperial West's role in Iran during the 1950s.

In The Cat and the Coup, you play as the cat of Mohammad Mosaddegh, the first democratically elected Prime Minister of Iran, and go through back in time his story as Prime Minister, starting with his death under house arrest, and ending with his defense of the nationalization of the oil in Iran. The Cat and the Coup is a must for anyone interested in Iranian history, and especially for anyone who hasn't heard of Anglo-American intelligence operations that led to Operation Ajax, and the outing of Dr.Mosaddegh.

A short visual novel, the few minutes you'll spend in The Cat and the Coup will detail to you the events that led up to Operation Ajax, and will, with subtle jabs, the imperialist ambitions of the West whose espionage led to Mossadegh's overthrow.

По сути игровой процесс состоит из нескольких мини-игр, на уровне ассоциаций и метафор отсылающих нас к событиям в Иране середины прошлого века. Здорово, что в игровой графике так удачно соеденены традиционные персидские миниатюры и современные политизированные коллажи. Такой сильный изобразительный ряд, да и музыка Nine Inch Nails и Эрика Сати способны пробудить интерес к истории, стоящей за этой игрой. Но даже если вам и неинтересны исторические факты, то сама атмосфера тут просто завораживающая. Игра короткая, бесплатная, отнюдь не сложная, но, по моему мнению, весьма способствующая самообразованию и рефлексиям на темы политики, культуры и истории.

You just pester him day and night: breaking all of his stuff, making him clean up after you, and then trying to murder him through a series of elaborate falls. Actually, in retrospect, it's a pretty great cat owner simulator. 10/10



Seriously though, its a great documentary oriented game with a bold art style. It gives a brief history over the fall of Prime Minister of Iran Mohammed Mossadegh. It's brief, but very enjoyable. Rather than being straight text, or even a series of corridors to walk through, it uses light platforming and physics puzzles (mostly through seesaw-like environments) to relay a bit of history.

26213207.review:
讲述伊朗总理摩萨台在国外势力策划的政变中被推翻的小游戏，整理流程不长，大约10分钟左右即可通关。
游戏本身挺有艺术感，画面主要采用拼贴手法，伊朗历史的繁复与政治漩涡中的乱象都有所表现。
谜题不难，在设计思路上也很连贯，基本都是“猫与房间”的谜题设置。
可惜的是，在游戏中反映政治不是不可，但表现的手段有高下之分。《猫与政变》大约是大声疾呼型，结果在游戏性上有些粗糙，与其说是游戏，不如说是宣传册子。
不过贵在免费，也贵在让遥远的中国人了解伊朗的一段辛酸史，还是好评。

25941567.review:
A free little art game with some light puzzling and a story about the US/UK-backed coup that overthrew Mohammed Mossadeq, the democratically elected leader of a free Iran. If you know the history, it won't tell you anything new, but it's a novel look at an under-studied moment in history -- one that in a lot of ways marks the ascendancy of the modern military industrial complex and the violence behind global neoliberalism.

Also you're a cat whose job is to break things.

25822423.review: Par son esthétique qui intéressera jusqu’à ses réfractaires, sa gratuité et ses vertus sinon pédagogiques, capables de piquer la curiosité assez fort pour nous envoyer jusque sur une page Wikipédia, The Cat and the Coup a tout d’une bonne intention. Mais il n’est pas que ça. C’est l’un de ces quarts d’heure qui, imperceptiblement, nous font grandir en tant que joueurs. C’est un panneau, un phare lancé dans le ciel pour briller au milieu du million des autres étoiles du possible. Une étape aussi insignifiante qu’elle est capitale pour la bonne pousse de ce média encore embryonnaire qu’est le jeu vidéo.

25713922.review:
An interesting little free game/experience.

You take the role of the cat of the first democratically elected Prime Minister of Iran, Dr. Mohammad Mossadegh, and you complete small puzzles to get him from one room to another while reading short summaries of the events that transpired during and after the 1953 Iranian coup.

The surrealistic artstyle is interesting and the music chosen is quite fitting. It has a sort of depressing atmosphere which is fitting for the story it tells.

"The Cat and the Coup" takes around 10-15 minutes to complete, so even if it would turn out that you didn't enjoy the game, it wouldn't be a massive timewaste to give it a try. I found it to be interesting and therefor I'll recommend it!

25694111.review: This very short game is interesting in a lot of ways. It is an experiment about games, about History, about news. 25525353.review:
A very short but highly entertaining lesson of (not particularly) recent history of Iran, shedding some light on one of the lesser know plottings of western politics. 

The general tone is a bit judgemental , which is ok, but a more differentiated (and detailed) look on this matter would give more room for discussions.

It doesn't tell anything new but the presentation and atmosphere is quite unique for a game. Kinda reminding me of early collages from the Dadaism movement. To understand all it's symbolisms you probably have to spend a bit more time than me.

The execution of riddles is well done. They are easy enough to not overshadow the information provided (little there is), but challenging enough to have fun with them. 

Best part: It's free.

[u]Judgement:[/u]
Worth the experience and a first step into a much more complex and (not exclusively) historical issue.

25358657.review:
[h1]The Cat and the Coup est un mini-jeux engagé et orignial.[/h1]

Bien qu'il se présente comme un jeu documentaire, il est aussi extrêmement pédagogique, car il éveille 
la curiosité et nous pousse à approfondir nos connaissances sur l'histoire de l'Iran contemporaine.
J'ai beaucoup aimé le parti-pris esthétique : on se promène de tableau en tableau, chacun correspondant à une date, un évènement. La beauté des collages et des motifs persans contraste avec la froideur des photos en noir et blanc, comme un rappel : ce n'est pas qu'un jeu, mais le conte d'une vie bien réelle.

[u]Les plus[/u] : gratuit, pousse à la curiosité et à l'esprit critique, beau, les développeurs citent leurs sources pour les références historiques.

[u]Les moins[/u] : très court, on aimerait plus de contenu, être encore plus immergé ; le côté "plateforme" du jeu n'apporte rien à la narration et est un peu buggé.

[u]Conclusion[/u] : Jeu à installer et essayer urgemment ! Il nous sensibilise à un passé proche dont on ne parle pas dans les livres d'histoire... A quand une version plus longue? un autre sujet? :)

24241245.review:
The Cat and the Coup è uno di quei giochi dove l'utilizzo del termine "gioco" si dimostra ambiguo e limitato, forse il termine più corretto sarebbe quello di "storia interattiva", o meglio ancora "storia giocosa".

La storia è quella del primo ministro iraniano democraticamente eletto Mohammad Mosaddegh e del colpo di stato del 1953 organizzato dalla CIA, alla richiesta dei servizi segreti britannici MI6.

Il gioco è di breve durata e racconta gli episodi salienti della carriera, deposizione e morte di Mossaddegh dal 1951 al 1953 mettendo il giocatore nei panni di un gatto nero, che attraverso le sue "marachelle" permette il procedere della storia fino alla sua triste conclusione.

L'estetica del gioco è incredibile, i disegni ben curati sono ispirati all'arte persiana ma modificati e organizzati in maniera tale da creare una scenografia meravigliosa.

Alla fine è un espierenza molto interessante, gratuita, che ti regala un excursus in una parte della Storia purtroppo spesso dimenticata.

È un gioco molto breve, ma che potenza. Assolutamente consigliato.

23492711.review:
As an art piece, I find this to be eloquent and intriguing. The art is fantastic and mesmerizing, complimenting the forgettable but suiting score. The symoblism used to represent events in Mossaddegh's life were well utilized and brings forth an interesting perspective on his life. 

On the other hand, the game isn't very good at telling you anything about Mosaddegh aside from the bare basics. It also doesn't help that the game is somewhat incoherent with how it presents its information as the order of info is done backwards, starting from the time of his death to the day he was elected.

Given that it's free, I'd recommend that you'd only blow ten minutes on this if you want a simple art piece to examine and have an interest in recent Iranian history.

마우스 화살표는 어디론가 사라지고 없고...
다만, 방향키와 스페이스바로만 움직이고 할퀴기(공격하기)해서 퍼즐을 푸는 게임이다.

화면상에 보면 고양이가 들어갈수 있는 빈 공간같은게 있을 것이다.
거기에 들어가서 할퀴기하면 여러가지 상황들이 발생하는데,
그러면서 방을 빠져나와서 다음방으로 가는 퍼즐같지 않은 게임이라고 할수 있다.

중간중간에 보여지는 그림들은 여기저기 역사적인 사진들을 짜집기해놨는데,
차분한 배경음악과 조화를 이루고 있다.
게임이 너무 짧은게 흠이긴하지만 한번쯤 해보면 재밌는 게임이다.
도전과제가 없는것도 조금 아쉬움이다.



평점 90점.


만약 이 게임을 회화로 본다면, 초현실주의작품같은 게임.
If you look at this game as a painting, surreal works such as games.

22335370.review:
[i] The Cat and the Coup [/i] tells the true story of the Western-backed overthrow of Mohammed Mossadegh, the first democratically-elected Prime Minister of Iran.

As history, it may be a bit confusing for those unfamiliar with the subject, because it's mostly told in reverse (though it sticks to basic facts rather than inundating the player wth obscure details). A perusal of the Wikipedia page regarding the coup might be a good idea before playing.

Gameplay-wise, it's a bit like walking through a picture book, with a few simple environmental puzzles to solve along the way. The game is very short (I finished it in 15 minutes without rushing) and boasts a unique art style: a mash-up of Persian motifs and Western surrealism, with a few agitprop touches along the way. I've never seen anything like it in a game before.

Is it fun to play? I guess so. Given how short it is, it definitely doesn't outstay its welcome. And seeing as it's free-to-play, there's no risk of suffering buyer's remorse. Unless you have a pathological aversion to anything that could even remotely be construed as an "art" game, I would recommend giving it a whirl.

On a personal level, I was very struck by the opening image of Mossadegh as an old man, lying on his deathbed more than a decade after his overthrow. A sound recording of one of Mossadegh's speeches (announcing the nationalization of Iran's oil industry -- an act that galvanized the West to plot his downfall) also struck a nerve. Before playing this game, I was already familiar with the history of the coup and its awful aftermath (the reign of the Shah and his secret police), but I had never given much thought to Mossadegh the [i] man [/i] before. It was also the first time I had ever heard his voice, despite having read much about him. In other words, [i] The Cat and the Coup [/i] not only succeeds in bringing to life an essential piece of 20th-century history, but it also humanizes the individual at the center of that story. In so doing, it conveys the sadness and cynicism of the coup in a visceral and memorable way.

21817409.review:
[h1] 一切皆好的游戏，然而并不想买账喝彩[/h1]

入了The cat and the Coup 完全是出于被画风吸引，当认真去看标题，再看了介绍和WIKI PEDIA...意识到这个游戏富含了政治色彩。

游戏页面操作非常简单，只需用上下左右键操作黑猫，并且按空格键一边解开谜题，一边看着这位伊朗第一位首相遭受政变的故事。游戏时长不超过10分钟。

然而写这篇评测内心是非常复杂的...

游戏操作流程非常舒畅，叙事手法也采用先倒叙的形式，回放着穆罕默德·摩萨台经历的整个事件，直至被石油“淹“没整个屏幕..游戏结束。

从画风来说，这是我就目前涉猎的游戏当中，所触及到的罕见的大量用到15世纪-16世纪的波斯画（Persian miniature) ，又穿插着20世纪的POP艺术和拼贴画动物肖像的游戏，这种极少出现在游戏的绘画风格着实为游戏加分。

其中，把每个实际发生的事件用英文简短的镶嵌在以一幅幅画作为一个个主题中，而每个动物画像又都突显隐喻。

不论是出现在背景中15,16盾甲兵（伊朗人民），揭示着被一个个伊朗政变冲突事件所围绕的当时的涉及石油利益的氛围。或是以犬和鹰比喻英美帝国主义的形象，偶尔出现在游戏中对待主人翁的穆罕默德·摩萨台的嘴脸。更让人嗟叹，游戏者操作的黑猫（联想到波斯猫）也隐喻了被英美爪牙操控的伊朗人去各种施压，推翻了自己的第一位首相的政权。

即便游戏开发者把这个游戏设为免费纪录向，又希望能用这样艺术的表现形式去吸引游戏者去关注这位首相悲怆的人生经历。

我仍然不太推荐一个富有争议又涉及政治事件的人物要用游戏的手段作为诠释。

21246421.review:
Definitely an artsy game that'll appeal to people who like video games for more than just being base entertainment.

...Like me!

"The Cat and the Coup" tells the story of the former Iranian Prime Minister, Mohammed Mossadegh, and... I really liked it. I wasn't sure what to think when I saw the advertising and also that this was on the "Video Games as Art" article on Wikipedia (which they also included "Tempest 2000" and "Vib Ribbon"... for some reason), but needless to say I was very impressed.

I really like the storybook aesthetics of the game, like you're seeing this history unfold across tapestries, old photographs, and pictures cut out of magazines. Along with this, the animations on Mossadegh and the Cat look very blocky but still well-animated, like they belong with the rest of the scattered images in the game. And the game mechanics and story are influenced by you as a little, black cat pushing around the unfortunate Mossadegh, which is incredibly symbolic.

See, throughout the game, a lot of the puzzles involve balance, almost as if saying that the Prime Minister was trying to find a balance between his people and the other countries looking to get that oil, but because of bad fortune in his path, he just happened to be a stepping stone for the U.S. to grind their feet into, and a door for the Iranian people to knock down, and move onto a better life. He's constantly falling and being messed with by the cat, which really makes you feel sorry for the poor chum. He was just trying to do what any man would do in his position, and he keeps getting sh** on. 

I can't think of any issues I had with the game, personally. The over-realiance on text here and there bothered me a little (but that's more of a personal gripe). Beyond that though, it uses intuitive puzzles to tell a story in a unique and intriguing manner. I can see some people throwing a fit for the game being 15 minutes, but it tells the story it aims to tell in that amount of time, and does it damn well. 

I'm gonna give "The Cat and the Coup" a 9/10. If you like what video games can do as an artform, and how they can effect people emotionally in their own unique manner, this game is definitely the game for you.

20718313.review:
简短的20分钟。 先逆向再正向，精妙的节奏控制让游戏在解谜关卡已经显得枯燥时戛然而止。从游戏机制上没什么问题，在表达上虽然用的是拼贴的效果，但是意外的给人感觉非常的有政治讽刺意味，大赞。
同样是学生作品（看后面是USC投资我觉得应该是），怎么国外就是这么牛逼呢？
游戏开始，伊朗第一位民选总理摩萨台安详地死去，死去之地对他最大的记述就是1951年完成了石油事业的国有化，这伟大的一步国家主义，伟大的一步独立事业，却使得他在后来，被西方"民"主国家，用尽手段赶下了权力之位。这是一个死局。
而我们要用一只黑猫的视角，回溯他从实行国有化以来的所有经历。他本以为可以靠着石油国有化，让伊朗腾飞，然后呢？他被自己的人民赶下了台，而这只不过来源于一场由美国策划的游行，这样一个恪尽职守的老人，还因为莫须有的罪名放上了法庭，以谋划干掉伊朗国王的名义。笑话，是伊朗国王最后为他求出一条生路的呵。
在这里我不想过多去评价政治方面的问题。我只能说这是一场闹剧，这是二战之后部分地区民族主义新民主国家惨烈尝试中的一个。靠着年轻的民主并不能冲击已经长时间发展壮大了的资本主义，只能被其征服。
但是伊朗的部分人并没有因为被美国打击就此放弃。现在他们应该是唯一一个在中东算是独立且主权统一的国家，这便是信念的传递吧，当初那些支持民选总理而被警察镇压的学生，也许现在也在伊朗的台前幕后为了自己的民族而奋斗呢？
少年变恶龙什么的只是一个同行的少年所见罢了，少年变强才是这句话的核心。
追忆历史的行程，而又要将视野随着时代变化而更新，这才能变得更强。

20146823.review:
[h1]優點[/h1]
1. 獨立免費
2. 藝術性質高，令人享受在遊戲中的每一秒鐘
3. 雖短，卻完整，不會覺得空虛
4. 音樂很美，尤其是搭配遊戲中的動作
5. 關卡簡單，不會因為關卡太難而迷失方向

[h1]缺點[/h1]
1. 無hint，首次接觸第一關有可能不懂怎麼玩(不過個人覺得無hint才不會破壞本作的塑造的氣氛)

[h1]評分[/h1]
遊戲耐玩度：07/10
畫面精緻度：08/10
音樂精緻度：08/10
推薦嘗試度：09/10

[h1]點評[/h1]
The cat and the Coup是一款藝文取向的免費獨立遊戲，他的主要內容乃是透過一隻黑貓的視角，從一個房間到另一個房間一點一滴地了解Mohammad Mosaddegh從政時所發生的事件。雖然這種略帶解謎要素的小遊戲以前曾經玩過，不過此類類傳記的方式與敘述手法實在太過新穎(應該說筆者玩過的遊戲太少)，是那種會在腦中留下深刻印象的遊戲。音樂不只與遊戲內事物有高度連結，也隨著事件進行有高低起伏，從而引起玩家帶入感。遊戲內沒有主觀的價值判斷，只有對史實的一行文字敘述與象徵性的房間，安靜略帶新奇的音樂使人沉靜於他所說的故事。

Mohammad Mosaddegh作為一位伊朗民選首相，任內大興改革，內政上將伊朗多處不合時宜、不公平的社會制度改變，外交上也透過石油國有化降低英國對伊朗的控制。而他執政期間的各式故事也對今天的伊朗有著重要的影響，可以透過這些事件進一步理解伊朗與西方國家尤其是英美的關係為何至此。

唯一不推薦的理由應該是語言與歷史，不會英語或對於伊朗歷史(/國際現狀)沒興趣可能不會這麼推薦，至於其他有條件的玩家們可以停下腳步花個十來分鐘體會一下藝術氛圍與歷史。

I wasn't sure what this game was but it was in my library so I decided to check it out.

From the start I could tell it was a school project because from the beginning there was a bit of text about a man's life. You didn't know exactly who he was but as you play the game you see more and more about his life. I was intrigued at the game because I was hoping it would do something more than just move a screen so I could read more text; some narration could have helped the game be more tolerable.

Why am I giving this game a "Not Recommend" someone may ask. It's because the game doesn't really offer any way to remember it. It's an educational game but doesn't present the information in any new way or in any effective way to recollect any of the information presented. I felt that reading a textbook would have been more effective and more entertaining.

The game isn't really much of a game. It's short and could have presented the same amount of information in a one minute blurb but is convinced that you should stay around for 10 minutes and move around a cat that seemingly has no point to exist in the game.

15303612.review:
The Cat and the Coup viene definito "un videogioco documentario". Questo suo dualismo va preso alla lettera e, insieme a una direzione artistica di primo livello, inteso come vero punto di forza dell'intera produzione. Perché "documentario": il titolo, dalla durata che oscilla intorno ai 15 minuti, descrive la vita di Mohammed Mossadegh, Primo Ministro iraniano, che negli anni Cinquanta del secolo scorso ebbe a scontrarsi con gli "interessi" solo europei prima, anche statunitensi poi, finendo infine per soccombere. La storia viene narrata à rebours, iniziando dall'ultimo istante di Mossadegh e progredendo dall'alto verso il basso in senso spaziale, ma dal basso verso l'alto in senso temporale per ripercorrere i principali eventi della sua vita politica dopo l'acquisizione della carica e la sua decisione più importante in ambito economico, che viene giustamente vista come "inizio" della fine. "Toccato il fondo" del gioco una rapida risalita ripercorrerà in senso inverso la vita del politico proponendo degli approfondimenti e dei chiarimenti. Questa interpretazione del tempo assolutamente non lineare e "mossa" rende assai più accattivante e "ludica" l'intera vicenda storica. Quest'ultima viene narrata con poche pennellate di scritto, in uno stile cronachistico essenziale che ci tiene fino alla fine a non trasmettere interpretazioni tramite le parole, ma piuttosto tramite simbolismi espressi con elementi grafici. Vedo che su questo punto molti si sono "lamentati" per un'eccessiva oscurità dei simboli, che richiedono al giocatore un background di conoscenze storiche  non del tutto scontate. In realtà, su sfondi visivamente impressionanti di motivi persiani, si sviluppano messaggi che hanno perlomeno due chiavi di interpretazione, di cui la più superficiale è facilmente fruibile e ugualmente appagante: per non rovinare le sorprese, menzionerò qui i più espliciti "animali politici". 
Arriviamo dunque alla seconda parte della definizione: perché "videogioco". Uno degli elementi più apprezzabili di The Cat and the Coup è che non rinuncia ad avere un gameplay e una interattività abbastanza estesa con gli ambienti proposti. L'alter ego del giocatore sarà infatti il gatto nero di Mossadegh che, come è noto, essendo capace di vedere i fantasmi, cerca in tutti i modi di far ridiscendere l'anima del padrone attraverso i gironi più drammatici del suo personale inferno. Questo in pratica si trasforma nel cercare un modo di interagire con le varie "scenette" storiche, simbolicamente dondolanti come se fossero appese a un filo, per far scivolare o brutalmente spingere Mossadegh e farlo cadere negli abissi della storia, fino appunto a "fargli toccare il fondo". Solo allora un getto infinito di nera cupidigia umana costringerà a una travolgente ascensione l'anima del defunto, sommergendo nel processo tutte le tappe della sua vita che vengono così implicitamente definite "storia sommersa". Le soluzioni di ogni scenetta non sono affatto immediate e lasciano sempre un sorriso (amaro) sul volto del giocatore. 
Azzeccatissimo corollario dell'esperienza è la scelta dei brani musicali, uno straniante mix di Nine Inch Nails e Satie. Ultimo tocco magistrale di un titolo che trasuda tutto il tempo, la dedizione e l'attenzione "accademica" che gli sono stati dedicati: particolarmente evidente è il coinvolgimento di un'istituzione universitaria (la University of Southern California).  In definitiva The Cat and the Coup è un altro bel colpo a favore dell'elevazione a arte del videogioco: pronto alla musealizzazione in una galleria interattiva, è sotto tutti gli aspetti un titolo che pone sotto ben altri riflettori il noto motto "History is our playground".

13832398.review:
[i]„Střípek íránských dějin.“[/i]

Tyhle hry mi dělají radost. Podobně jako výtečný [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/258890/]Type:Rider[/url], se i tento kousek ohlíží do minulosti a popisuje historické události. Budete sledovat život Muhammada Mosaddeka, prvního demokraticky zvoleného premiéra Íránu, který roku 1951 znárodnil tamní ropný průmysl, do té doby kontrolovaný Británií. Té se tento krok vůbec nezamlouval a rozhodla se zakročit. Pod taktovkou USA, tak byla spuštěna operace Ajax, jejímž cílem bylo odstavení Mosaddeka od moci. Britské a americké tajné služby, začaly podněcovat protivládní protesty, které v roce 1953 vyústily v jeho svržení a uvěznění.

Hru lze označit jako plošinovku, ve které hrajete za černou kočku, doprovázející Mosaddeka jeho vzpomínkami. Na události je nahlíženo retrospektivně, kdy začínáte v okamžiku jeho skonu, a následně se společně vracíte zpět časem. Budete tak němými svědky všech důležitých momentů, v životě tohoto politika. Narazíte také na několik prostorových hádanek, ale nejedná se o nic složitého, jejich řešení vám zabere maximálně pár minut.

Velice zajímavé je grafické zpracování, připomínající perské miniatury, často kombinované s divokými kolážemi. Hra má díky tomu jedinečnou atmosféru, která je místy komická i zneklidňující zároveň. Skvělá je také melancholická hudba, složená ze tří skladeb. Tu první napsal francouzský klavírista Erik Satie, zbylé dvě, pak americká skupina Nine Inch Nails.

Hra vás bude stát jen patnáct minut a nabízí neobvyklý zážitek. Pokud tedy patříte mezi zvídavé hráče, pak máte mé doporučení.

Trippin' balls, man...

But seriously, this has "modern art" written all over it.  For those that hate games that are light on gameplay and heavy on metaphor... well, that's exactly what this game is.  

It's strictly linear, with no chance for exploration, and there are just a few sorta-puzzles to keep you entertained while you go backwards through time without context.  Then, it reverses, and you see the events play out in the proper order in context, with the disguised elements revealed for what they really are.

13400643.review:
The Cat and the Coup is a nice little addition in favor of the 'games can be art' debate.  It's quite short, but doesn't need to be long to get its point across.  It is part history lesson and part surrealistic visual story, and although the game play is sparse, it's still there.  This game wasn't 'fun' in the traditional sense, but rather it was more intriguing, as well as somewhat haunting with it's bizarre imagery coupled with the sad lingering soundtrack.       

For those who didn't understand the metaphors in this game, I will explain below.  
Scroll down or 'read more' for spoilers.
























  

You play as the black cat, traditionally established as a symbol of misfortune, who manipulates the various items and situations in a series of rooms.  By doing so, you move Dr. Mossadegh through those different rooms as he struggles to adapt to the changes you are indirectly creating.  Note that at no time is it stated that the cat belongs to Dr. Mossadegh, but rather it is a cat that incessantly follows him around.  

The rooms are a double-metaphor serving as both the various political/social occurrences at the time, and as stages of Dr. Mossadegh's life.  The cat is a metaphor for the CIA.  The cat's behavior is the covert tampering that CIA agents performed to maneuver Dr. Mossadegh into the situation where he would be removed from power.  The bulldog represents British interests who, behind closed doors, asked the Americans for undercover aid to depose Dr. Mossadegh from power.  The reasons for Britain doing this are spelled out at the end of the game in the vertical assent back through the imagery the cat initially fell downward through.  So, long story short, when you play this game, you play as the CIA covertly creating a social/political environment necessary to bring about a coup in Iran in the 1950's.  

Why was the story told in reverse?  I assume that is just artistic license in story telling, but I could be wrong.

13153181.review:
[h1]Bullet points[/h1]
[list]
  [*] Technically a puzzle platformer, but that's reeeeeally stretching it; really, it's a (very) short visual novel
  [*] Tells the story of a controversial piece of Iranian history
  [*] Well-executed, whimsical art style
[/list]
[h1]Full review[/h1]

A short review, for a short (15 minutes) game; essentially it's a 10-20 minute long history lesson (depending on how fast you read, and figure out the puzzles).  I liked the way the story was told, and the music (some of it from Nine Inch Nails, released under a Creative Commons license) complements the artsy visuals really well.  I was actually a little surprised, given the "documentary" nature, that it didn't have some kind of interactive bibliography at the end; that's not a complaint, just an observation.

As a puzzle platformer (which, from a mind-numbingly pedantic genre classification standpoint, this is), this game is a solid 1/10.  :)  Technically, there is platforming.  Technically, there are puzzles.  Neither of the above will present more than a minor speed bump to all but the most absolutely novice gamer.  You can also see "clues" for most of the "puzzles" in the Steam video trailer.

If you've ever wondered whether you might be interested in computer-based visual novels, this is a title to check out since it's free; not to mention, you'll learn a little history along the way!

[h1]If you like this game, check out...[/h1]
[list]
  [*] [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/234940]The 39 Steps[/url]
[/list]
Be aware that I'm stretching a bit on that recommendation; I really don't know anything else in the "visual novel documentary with a bit of gaming" sub-genre.  "The 39 Steps" is purely an interactive novel.

12563403.review:
The Cat and The Coup is a very short game where you kind of play a history lesson... as a cat. I like history and I love all animals, and I really love games where you get to play as animals. I first got interested in it when I saw the art, which is this really cool style that looks kind of like a scrap book. I was further interested when I saw that you get to play as a cat. It took me 20 minutes to play through it because there aren't any real directions and a couple of the rooms were really confusing for me, in regards to what you had to do to progress. In order to get further into the brief history lesson, you have to interact with the environment in such a way that leads the human to fall out of the room you're in and into the next room. The music in the game, paired with the art and photos, gives it a great atmosphere. I am definitely having my history buff friend play this, just because it was an interesting game. I got to have fun while learning something new. Now if only all history classes were taught like this, I think more kids might pay attention.

背景知识：

穆罕默德·摩萨台（1882年6月16日－1967年3月5日），于1951年至1953年间出任民选的伊朗首相，但在1953年被美国中央情报局策动的政变推翻。

这是一个小品级的历史类解谜游戏。游戏中，玩家将通过操作一只黑猫触发机关迫使摩萨台从一个场景转移至另一个场景，而每一个场景都对应一个特点的历史阶段。刚开始时你可能会感到费解，但当游戏结束时，你将得到一条来自非西方国家学者所整理提出的历史时间线，从而了解美国人是怎样推翻摩萨台政权的。

黑猫本身就是一个很巧妙的创意，它在很多文化中所代表的便是神秘与厄运；随着这只神秘黑猫的干预，摩萨台不得不一步步坠向深渊。而临近结尾时，一个人捧起了这只猫：他会不会就是美国人的象征呢？

背景音乐简单而不单调，关卡背景中的插画看似随意却无时不传达着真相与讽刺。整个游戏旨在向西方玩家揭示一段被他们的政府所隐瞒的黑历史，一场美国所策划的干涉他国内政的政变阴谋。

（预计游戏流程：20分钟）

11916101.review: The Cat and the Coup is a visually arresting, surreal history lesson chronically the life and death of Dr. Mohammed Mossadegh. Half edutainment, half bizarre art project, it's an entirely unique and wonderfully creative 15 minute fall down an abstract rabbit hole, reinforced with the snippets of real world events that somehow only make it all the more unusual. Personally I found it a brilliant experimental experience, though for as odd as it is I can just as easily imagine a dozen entirely different opinions about it, which perhaps says something to how weird a game it is. Thankfully I don't have to decide for you whether to give The Cat and the Coup a look, as it's entirely free and will take just a small portion of your day to complete. At the very least it's almost certainly the oddest use of a Nine Inch Nails song I've ever found, which in itself I find strangely compelling.

11002526.review: I have mixed feelings about this game, but ultimately it is worthy of a playthrough, or at least a partial playthrough. The concept is brilliant, and I applaud the idea of bringing attention to causes, plights, opinions, politics and philosophy through the gaming medium. This game is also actually a game on a technical level, as it has challenges to solve through manipulating a character, although it really just barely qualifies as a game. The animation and art is really wonderfully done, and is stylized in a way that has aristic value and restraint not usually seen in gaming. The downside is that it is boring, as a story, and that the gameplay is essentially a frustrating element designed to keep the story from being told in a rapid series of clicks. So in the end it is worth looking at the concept, as it is entirely brilliant; the content, however, is hit-and-miss, with the art as the major notable hit and most everything else a near- or far- miss. Mixed bag. [ 6 / 10 ]

9184627.review:
Though the facts might be intruiging and not widely known among Americans, and the visuals be beautiful and strange, The Cat and the Coup is a diorama; a visual and marginally interactive history lesson. Not a game. That aside, and other issues (below) notwithstanding, it's also only a fistful of minutes long so it never adds up to being enough to be satisfying. 

Despite the particular history it covers and its intrigue to me personally, between the popular allegorical preachiness of some of its imagery and the breakdown of play to the point of throwing up rote data less than halfway through, i couldn't help but feel the crassness of propaganda running through "Coup"'s fabric. It may be that that's due more to its being billed as a game than anything else, and that somewhere in the back of my mind i felt a little tricked when "Coup" quit being interactive. I'm a huge fan of Joe Sacco's purely journalistic comics, and interested in similarly untraditional ways of telling people's personal histories, but I guess part of why I felt tricked might have something to do with the fact that this wasn't a person's story. It was mere names and dates, and seeming laziness on the part of the illustrators and programmers. Like they made a third of a game and got tired of it, deciding to just get the process over with and publish. If you can get past this, and the history is unknown to you or interesting enough to spend fifteen minutes on, have at it. You'll enjoy it. And to be fair, this is my first encounter with subject material like this being disseminated in this way and for that the publishers deserve credit.

I'll recommend it with a "Meh".

1909482.review:
Développé par the University of Southern California, The Cat and the Coup est un jeu documentaire (gratuit) dans lequel le joueur interprète le chat du premier ministre iranien Mohammed Mossadegh, figure emblèmatique du nationalisme moyen-oriental.
A travers une série de tableaux dans lequel le joueur est invité à interagir pour faire avancer l'action, l'histoire retrace les derniers événements marquants de la vie politique de Mossadegh et son écartement du pouvoir de Mossadegh par un "coup" fomenté par les services britanniques et américains.
Récompensé aux IndieCade 2010, le jeu révèle, dans les années 1950, l'ingérence des Etats-Unis dans les affaires étrangères dans le contexte contemporain de la guerre en Irak. Pour Peter Brinson (l'un des deux développeur du jeu), il paraît important "à l'art (et aux jeux vidéos) d'encourager les débats autour de la pertinence de notre politique étrangère".
Au niveau de la facture graphique, les tableaux successifs sont truffés de figures allégoriques évoquant les personnages historiques concernés et de symboles faisant référence à des nations et des événements tandis que des phrases rythment le déroulement à rebours de l'histoire. Le tout dans une esthétique inspirée de l'art perse, le soft surprend aussi par une bande son minimale (Nine Inch Nails et Erik Satie).
Dans ce court jeu documentaire (genre que j'espère voir se développer par la suite), il ne faut toutefois pas s'attendre à une jouabilité extrême car celui-ci invite en effet davantage à la contemplation (voire l'apprentissage).

Bon jeu :)

6483754.review:
This is less a conventional video game and more like an interactive documentary with some clever physics puzzles thrown in. On that level, it's supremely compelling: a visually striking, info-rich, contextualized narrative about the political career of Dr. Mohammad Mossadegh, the first democratically elected Prime Minister of Iran, and how it intertwines with the country's role in the global oil industry. I realize that this isn't usually the remit of most titles on Steam, but if you're even remotely fascinated by the subject matter, I would highly recommend checking it out.

The rich graphics are combination of traditional Persian art with Terry Gilliam-esque cutout animation -- think Monty Python's Flying Circus, and it meshes effectively with the political content.  

The moody, atmospheric soundtrack is adapted from two Nine Inch Nails songs, released under a Creative Commons license, and it's a surprisingly appropriate fit with the rest of the game.

The physics-oriented puzzles are rather simplistic, but I can't begrudge the designers for that -- they're really just an artificial mechanism for regulating the pace of the story, rather than anything intended for true gaming pleasure.

Best of all, it's completely FREE. Really, The Cat and the Coup deserves all the attention, support, and praise that it can get.

A masterfully done documentary-game.

This game presents history of an individual in such a way I found so strangely compelling and so unique I would even say I would pay for it, considering it is free. It follows the story of Prime Minister of Iran, Mohammed Mossadegh, and his subsequent downfall through a CIA- and MI6-engineered coup during the 1950s despite being the first democratically elected leader..

It's rare to find a game that teaches you and wonderfully presents itself in both gameplay and how each segment of Mossadegh's life is shown through old Persian-rug weaves. There is a mix between the mystical and the imaginable, the real and the ethereal and I believe that Peter Brinson and Kurosh ValaNejad who made the game did a superb job on the way each conflicts with each other.

An exemplary for those who wish to claim that 'game as an art'.

Or perhaps it is just me being a niche-game collector/player... hahaha..

1095956.review:
Air Conflicts: Secret Wars is an arcade flight simulation set in a world war I + II scenario. During the 7 campaigns the player has to fly and fight through 49 missions. Before taking off, the player can choose between different aircrafts, each with different strengths and weaknesses.

Within the missions the player gets different objectives like patrolling, sneaking, hit & run, bombing and escorting. Objectives are presented as dialogues between different characters. After some missions the player can upgrade one of his skills in order to maneuver the airplanes easier, have more endurance or have your wingman boosted. Further, the player can choose between two control schemes. Arcade and simulation. The first one makes the game easier to control, while the second one gives more options to control the aircraft.

Beside the campaign the game also features several multiplayer modes, local and via internet for up to four players.

The game teaches you more than just the game mechanics, it illrustrates the life of Iran's Prime Minister, Dr. Mohammad Mossadegh.

Playing as his cat, you coax Mossadegh through events in his life. You interact both with the world and Mossadegh himself to solve puzzles as a means to transition through chronological events.

The Persian miniature art style is beautiful and works well for this game.

The only down side is the play time which runs about 10 minutes. The game was really enjoyable and I would have liked to see a lengthier product.
